snippet: The fighting, which forced the closing of the Torkham crossing, left at least 13 wounded in Pakistan and killed least one Afghan police officer.
abstract: Pakistani and Afghan forces clash near Torkham border crossing, leaving at least one person dead and more than dozen others injured.

byline.original: By ISMAIL KHAN and ROD NORDLAND
byline.contributor: Ismail Khan reported from Peshawar, and Rod Nordland from Kabul, Afghanistan. Jawad Sukhanyar contributed reporting from Kabul, and Khalid Alokozay from Jalalabad, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: The fighting, which forced the closing of the Torkham crossing, left at least 13 wounded in Pakistan and killed least one Afghan police officer.

headline.main: Afghanistan and Pakistan Exchange Heavy Gunfire Along Border
headline.print_headline: Heavy Gunfire Traded Across Afghan-Pakistan Border, Escalating Tensions
